pullRequest.body:
A finite `G`-set is connected if and only if the `G`-action is transitive.

---

nodes.body: :v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

bors d+
bors d+

As the parameter `ReflectsIsomorphisms` the obviously expected typeclass, I think we may shorten the name:
```suggestion
theorem ConcreteCategory.isIso_iff_bijective [ReflectsIsomorphisms (forget C)]
```

```suggestion
/-- An object is not initial if and only if its fiber is nonempty. -/
lemma not_initial_iff_fiber_nonempty (X : C) : (IsInitial X → False) ↔ Nonempty (F.obj X) := by
```
In mathlib, USA-English is favored against UK-English. Then, I am afraid you should also rename `FibreFunctor` as `FiberFunctor`, etc.

This is unfortunate, `FiberFunctor` looks horrible to my eyes, well I will of course try to adhere to the convention. Since I don't want to produce any merge conflicts with this and the parallel PR: Should I fix the spelling when these two are merged? Since I need to change this at quite a few places.
The change for `FibreFunctor` can be done separately, but I would suggest that for the new definitions here, the change "fibre" -> "fibre" is applied immediately.
This instance should be moved to the file `CategoryTheory.FintypeCat`.

I am not sure about this, since this would require importing `RepresentationTheory.Action.Concrete` in `CategoryTheory.FintypeCat`. Do you think this is fine? Maybe its better the other way round? I.e. put it in `RepresentationTheory.Action.Concrete`? There we already have the `FintypeCat` import.
I was referring to the `ReflectsIsomorphisms` instance.
I replaced it with `Full (forget FintypeCat)` in `CategoryTheory.FintypeCat`.
This instance should be moved to the file `CategoryTheory.Limits.FintypeCat`.

```suggestion
  notInitial := not_initial_of_inhabited (Action.forget _ _) h.some
```
The `let x : X := i.hom y` should be moved before the `obtain...` where it is actually used.

Do you know why I can't write `obtain ⟨σ, hσ⟩ := MulAction.exists_smul_eq G (i.hom y : X) x'` (and drop the auxiliary definition)? In this case Lean says `failed to synthesize instance: MulAction.IsPretransitive G ↑(Action.FintypeCat.ofMulAction G X).V`, which strikes me as strange, since I explicitly give the type annotation `i.hom y : X`.

I think that `show X from i.hom y` would also work here. I am not expert enough to know exactly what is happening, but basically it may come from the fact that Lean sees a term in `↑(Action.FintypeCat.ofMulAction G X).V` rather than the coercion of `X` to a type, even though they are definitionally equal: instances that are found for `X` may not be found for the other.
Most of the `letI` here should be replaced by `let`.

```suggestion
instance : Full (forget FintypeCat) :=
    inferInstanceAs (Full FintypeCat.incl)
```
